feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 13 at 11:08AM AKDT until June 15 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...High Surf expected. Strong southwesterly winds with gusts to 40 mph will create heavy wave action and will push the water levels 2 to 3 feet above the normal high tide line. * WHERE...Southern Seward Peninsula Coast.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 13 at 11:08AM AKDT until June 15 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...High Surf expected. Strong southwesterly winds with gusts to 50 mph will create heavy wave action and will push the water levels 2 to 3 feet above the normal high tide line. * WHERE...Bering Strait Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 3:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Koyukuk River Downstream of Allakaket to Hughes. * WHEN...Until 100 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas is expected. Gravel bars will be submerged. Water will flow over banks into low lying

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:13PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Expected This Week... Heavy rain is expected over the northeast Brooks Range east of the Dalton Highway from Monday evening through Wednesday. Rainfall totals from 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. Runoff from this rainfall and remaining snowpack will cause rivers draining the northeast Brooks Range to rise to bankfull levels in some
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 12 at 1:38PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Rivers draining the Brooks Range east of the Dalton Highway. * WHEN...From 10 PM AKDT this evening through Wednesday evening.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 12:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Runoff from heavy rain in the Brooks Range late last week is moving down the Koyukuk River. The crest of high water is expected to reach Huslia from Wednesday into Thursday. This high water will cause erosion of the Koyukuk River bank at Huslia. Residents should prepare for significant erosion of the riverbank and high
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 13 at 9:15AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area through Wednesday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 1:29PM MDT until June 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR CENTRAL LAS ANIMAS COUNTY IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. However small hail, gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Chelan, Badger Mountain Road, Pangborn Airport, Entiat, Cashmere, Waterville, Mansfield, Quincy, Othello, Moses Lake, Number 2 Canyon, Number 1 Canyon, Wenatchee, and Ephrata.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Moses Lake Area; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 4:37AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG AND GUSTY WEST WINDS TO DEVELOP TODAY ACROSS THE CENTRAL COLUMBIA GORGE AND HOOD RIVER VALLEY... An unseasonably strong but dry cold front will sweep across the Pacific Northwest, causing west winds to increase throughout the day today. Widespread west winds of 15 to 25 mph will develop by this afternoon through most of the central Columbia Gorge and

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued June 13 at 2:57AM PDT until June 13 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BECOMING WINDY LATER TODAY... .A cold front will sweep across the forecast area on this afternoon resulting in increasing westerly winds combined with low relative humidities. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 9:58AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...NEAR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST MINNESOTA AND NORTHWEST WISCONSIN... Dry conditions and breezy winds will lead to near critical fire weather conditions today. Northerly winds today will be around 5 to 12 MPH with gusts up to near 20 MPH. Minimum relative humidity values of 20 to 30 percent are expected.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 10:03AM MDT until June 17 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. For the Green River Basin...including Big Piney, La Barge...elevated river levels are forecast.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 8:18AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Several days of heavy rainfall in western Hot Springs County has caused flows to increase on Owl Creek. Additionally, releases from Anchor Dam will be increased today to mitigate concerns in that area. Flows in Owl Creek are expected to be bankfull and higher to cause minor flooding concerns from Anchor Dam down to the Bighorn River.
